Over the past two years, he has consistently shared his technical expertise and insights with the AWS community through blogging and speaking.

name: Minoru Onda
description:
Minoru Onda is a Technology Evangelist at KDDI Agile Development Center Corporation (KAG). While engaging in software development, he also shares the knowledge gained from his work outside his company, spreading the excitement of technology to many people.


He joined the AWS User Group Japan (JAWS-UG) in 2021 and now leads the operations of three communities: the Tokyo chapter, the SRE chapter, and NW-JAWS. In 2023, he delivered over 30 technical talks and authored more than 70 blog posts, while creating numerous opportunities for his fellow members to share their knowledge and experiences. In recognition of his contributions, he was selected as an AWS Samurai 2023.


Recently, he has been focusing on utilizing Generative AI on AWS, sharing case studies from his company, explaining new features, and creating hands-on content. In 2024, he led the co-authoring of an introductory technical book on Amazon Bedrock with community members, which was published in Japan and became a best seller.

name: Namrata Shah
description: Description not found

name: Nathan Glover
description: Nathan is a Platform Engineer at First Mode in Perth, Western Australia. Prior to that he worked as a Senior DevOps Consultant at Mechanical Rock and as a Hardware Systems Designer and Embedded Developer in the IoT space. In his role he enabled developers to iterate on ideas faster by building out repeatable patterns for testing & deploying to the edge.  He is passionate about Cloud Native architecture and loves sharing his successes and failures on his blog. A key focus for him is breaking down the learning barrier by building practical examples using Cloud services. On top of these he has a number of online courses teaching people how to get started building with Amazon Alexa Skills and AWS IoT.  In his spare time, he loves to dabble in all areas of technology; building cloud connected toasters, embedded systems, vehicle tracking, and competing in online capture the flag security events. Hes also the technical director for WA Animals Inc. and has built out a number of projects for managing historically tedious form processing in a serverless way.

name: Nick Triantafillou
description:
Nick is a Cloud Engineer, Educator, User Group founder, and Christmas Light enthusiast.


Having worked as a Linux System Administrator for over 20 years, he discovered AWS in 2009 and hasn't looked back. He was one of the original course instructors at the cloud education startup A Cloud Guru, having taught over 1 million students the fundamentals of AWS, and also produced the world's first AWS Certified DevOps Engineer course.


He's the founder of his local Wollongong AWS User Group, co-founder of the Sydney Serverless Meetup and has assisted in the planning and operation of both the ServerlessConf and ServerlessDays ANZ conferences.


He currently runs @NickExplainsAWS, where he is attempting to make a video about every single AWS service on TikTok and YouTube.


Each December Nick brings traffic to a standstill by installing over 75,000 LEDs on his house for his serverless, AWS powered light show spectacular.


You can keep up to date with Nick's latest projects via his blog or LinkedIn.

name: Nilesh Vaghela
description:
Nilesh Vaghela is the founder of ElectroMech Corporation, an AWS Cloud and open source focused company (the company started as an open source model). Nilesh has been very active in the Linux community since 1998. He started working with AWS Cloud technologies in 2013 and in 2014 he trained a dedicated cloud team and started full support of AWS Cloud services as an AWS Standard Consulting Partner. He always works to establish and encourage cloud and open source communities.


He started the AWS Meetup community in Ahmedabad in 2014 and the Meetup has grown to include over 4500 members. Nilesh also created a Facebook group for AWS enthusiasts in Ahmedabad, with over 1800 members.


Apart from the AWS Meetup, Nilesh has delivered a number of seminars, workshops, and talks around AWS awareness at various organizations, colleges, and universities. He has also been active in working with startups, presenting AWS services overviews and discussing how startups can benefit the most from using AWS services.


Nilesh is trainer for Red Hat Linux Technologies and AWS Cloud technologies.

name: Niv Yungelson
description:
Niv works at Melio where she was the first DevOps engineer at the company, and is now the DevOps Team Lead. She is also co-leader of the AWS Israel User Group, one of the biggest AWS User Groups in the world. As a community leader, she organizes Meetups and ensures they include underrepresented groups in the technology industry. She achieves this by both collaborating with other User Groups and experimenting with new initiatives.


Niv also volunteers as an instructor in OpsSchool, which is a non-profit program meant to gather industry leaders to contribute together, train new DevOps engineers, and help the community continue the cycle of good deeds. She is active in tech user groups, forums, and Meetups, and is committed to sharing her knowledge and experience at any given opportunity.

name: Paloma Lataliza
description:
Paloma is a Cloud Engineer with over six years of experience. She has a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, specialized in Cloud Computing, and is an enthusiast of container technologies and passionate about technology and sharing knowledge.


For more than four years, Paloma has been actively involved in technology communities. She leads the AWS User Group Minas Gerais, is an organizer of the AWSome Women Community Summit Brazil, and founded the Mulheres na Nuvem Minas Gerais (Women in the Cloud Minas Gerais) project. Previously, she was an AWS Community Builder, producing technical content, speaking at Cloud and DevOps events, and mentoring those eager to deepen their technical skills.


Within the AWS community, she realized the true meaning of 'community,' which inspired her to commit to transformative causes, such as supporting people in social vulnerability and women in STEM. She dedicates herself to helping more women enter the tech, creating a support network, and offering free classes and mentoring to women on their journey.


Paloma continues to positively impact the female community and build a solid career as a cloud engineer.

name: Pamela Gotti
description:
Pamela is Chief Technology Officer at Credimi, where she brings together finance and technology. Since the startup was born, her team has leveraged AWS to quickly deliver business value. She loves to design systems with clear boundaries through domain-driven design and event storming, and to bring them to life on Amazon EKS, with a mix of AWS Lambda, Amazon RDS, and Amazon S3.


She has given talks about how Credimi uses AWS to implement new features, microservices communication approaches (from event-driven architecture to GraphQL), and about team organization.  Since 2018 Pamela has led the tech team of SheTech, organizing events that help women build coding skills. The coding bootcamps focus on machine learning with Python, web development with JavaScript, and serverless.

name: Paolo Latella
description:
CTO and Co-Founder of Recube a company that encourages innovation and Cloud adoption starting from people. Cloud enthusiast with than 10 years of experience on Amazon Web Services. I assist companies on their digital transformation mixing IT strategy and AWS cloud technologies. I've been an Amazon Authorized Instructor since 2014 and assist AWS on education of current and future generations of Cloud professionals. As an AWS Hero, I love to spend time advocating and evangelizing others about AWS services and Cloud in general. Prominent leader within the Italian AWS community, I frequently participate as speakers at several IT conferences.


He graduated from the University of Rome "La Sapienza" in Computer Engineering, publishing a thesis about Auto configuration and monitoring of Wireless Sensors Network. After graduating, he received a research grant for the study of advanced network systems and mission critical services at the CASPUR (Consorzio Applicazioni Supercalcolo per Universita e Ricerca) now CINECA.


Paolo hosts regular meetings as the Co-Founder of AWS User Group Italia and AWS User Group Ticino. He can also be found participating at various technology conferences in Italy.

name: Partha Balasubramanian
description:
Parthasarathi (Partha) is a Cloud Solution Architect at 8K Miles, helping large Fortune 500 pharmaceutical and life science customers build highly available, scalable, and secure cloud infrastructure for their application deployments in the AWS Cloud.


Before joining 8K Miles, he worked at AstraZeneca and Logitech as a Cloud Infrastructure Engineer focused on cloud architecture, migration, and network security. As a cloud enthusiast who has been an AWS user since 2013, he holds the AWS Certified Solution Architect Professional & Certified Security Specialty certifications. Currently he is focusing on DevOps, serverless, containers, and Kubernetes on AWS.


Partha founded the AWS User Group Chennai in 2018. Currently it has 3000+ active members, and continues to interest and attract many in the cloud space. He regularly organizes AWS User Group meetups as well as the first-ever AWS Community Day Chennai 2019, which was a grand success, with 450+ participants. He also started the AWS User Group India Facebook page for organizing live webinars, which has attracted 1100+ followers within a span of two months time.


Partha regularly speaks at AWS User Group meetups, delivers guest lectures, and conducts workshops on AWS Cloud computing for students at engineering colleges and universities in Chennai.

name: Peter Sankauskas
description:
Peter Sankauskas is the Founder and CEO of Ensorcell. Ensorcell is a next-generation spreadsheet - one that understands the context of what you are working on and know how to update itself.


Since 2013, he has organized the Advanced AWS Meetup in San Francisco where his passion for scalability, reliability and simplicity has helped countless people get the most out of the cloud.


Previously, Peter has been the Chief Product & Technology Officer @ Hustle , CTO @ Reach, a Principal Engineer @ Caffeine, and the Founder of Answers for AWS. In 2013, Peter became a Netflix OSS Cloud Prize winner for his work in making it easy to get up and running with multiple Netflix projects. His most widely used open source contribution however, was back in 2011 when he added the EC2 inventory plugin to Ansible.

name: Philippe Abdoulaye
description:
Philippe is the manager of Amaris Consulting cloud offer, an AWS advisory consulting business specializing on how to leverage the cloud to boost business performance. His main goal is to advise companies on how to transform IT infrastructure and IT organizations using AWS. He developed two architecture frameworks to speed up AWS architecture design and implementation, they include Amaris 360 Cloud Architecture and AWS Extended EC2 (xEC2).


He wrote seven books with one cited among the global top 20 and 100+ articles on AWS, DevOps, and digital transformation and gives conferences on how to leverage AWS to boost businesses.


He regularly publishes on social networks including the AWS Community Network, Amazon AWS Architects, and LinkedIn, particularly focusing on AWS best practices under the label of  I Transform IT with AWS. 


His work on cloud computing has been featured on Forbes, ZDNet and foreign technology news websites like Germanys ComputerWoche. His background is in Computer Science and he is very interested in IoT, AWS architecture, and the AWS-based IT Organization for the COVID-19 business context.

name: Rafał Mituła
description:
Rafa is a Cloud Data Engineer and Architect within the Data & AI division at Chaos Gears. He is always eager to tackle new challenges and find innovative and effective solutions. This dedication extends to his goal of constantly expanding his knowledge and proficiency in solutions architecture.


Rafa is actively involved in the AWS community, co-organizing the AWS User Group Warsaw meetups and the AWS Community Day Poland conference. Besides his technical and organizational roles, Rafa shares his expertise by speaking at conferences and leading workshops aimed at introducing newcomers to AWS and data analytics, such as the AWS Data Engineering Immersion Days. In addition, Rafa creates content about AWS and data engineering, which he shares on the Chaos Gears blog and his LinkedIn page.

name: Raphael Quisumbing
description: Description not found

name: Rehan van der Merwe
description:
Rehan is a developer, architect, and AWS junkie at heart, while consuming an unhealthy amount of coffee, he focuses on serverless and all that AWS has to offer.


He organizes the AWS PTA Meetup and does the occasional presentation as well. He is an avid blogger helping the AWS community where possible, always lurking in all the #aws slack channels and answering questions.


Rehan has a strong background in Electronic and Electronic Communications Engineering, but has shifted focus to everything AWS. He has/have held multiple AWS certifications (including AWS Certified Solutions Architect  Professional) and is passionate about serverless and architecting for big data and microservices.


His favorite language is TypeScript but he is multilingual and has touched on many industries and technologies. Where he has worn many different hats like; backed developer, full stack developer, architect, platform, SRE, DevOps, and team lead.

name: Rick Hwang
description:
Rick is a cloud and infrastructure architect at 91APP in Taiwan. He started his AWS journey in 2012 and has worked with most core AWS services. Since 2015 he has been leveraging AWS to build and manage reliable OMO solutions for 10,000 customers. In addition to building infrastructure from scratch on AWS, Rick now oversees the team on overall management, cost, DevOps, and security.


Ricks passion to educate developers has been demonstrated both internally as an annual AWS training project leader, and externally as a community owner of SRE Taiwan. Rick started SRE Taiwan on his own and has recruited over 3,600 members over the past 4 years via peer-to-peer interactions, constantly sharing content, and hosting annual study group meetups.


Rick enjoys helping people increase their understanding of AWS and the cloud in general. He keeps himself updated with all the latest AWS services and features. Currently, he is exploring AWS security and distributed systems solutions.

name: Rolf Koski
description:
Rolf works at Knowit, which is an AWS Premier Partner from the Nordics headquartered in Sweden. He works as the VP and Chief Commercial Officer at Knowits Managed Services business. In his role he is both technical as well as being the thought leader in the Cloud. He currently advocates for Generative AI and Sustainability initiatives in Cloud.


Rolf has been one of the leading figures at the Nordic AWS Communities as one of the community leads in Helsinki and Stockholm user groups and he initially founded and organized the first ever AWS Community Days Nordics, which remains active and annual even to the day.

name: Ryan Kroonenburg
description:
Ryan is an experienced Solutions Architect within the United Kingdom who went on to found A Cloud Guru, an online community that is dedicated to teaching all aspects of the AWS platform. Ryan has taught AWS to over 1,000,000 students globally and together with his brother Sam Kroonenburg has founded one of the first serverless start ups in 2015. Ryan is a cloud enthusiast and is helping to organize serverless conferences and meetups across the world.


Ryan has a Bachelors Degree in Accounting & Finance from Curtin University in Perth, Australia. In addition, Ryan has many IT certs including ITILv3, MCITP, MS SQL DBA etc. Ryan currently holds 7 of the 11 AWS certificates and is currently working on the Machine Learning Specialty qualification.


Ryan is always eager to talk about cloud and A Cloud Guru is always looking for industry leading experts to become instructors on the A Cloud Guru Platform.

name: Sabiha Ali
description:
Sabiha Ali is a Solutions Architect at ScaleCapacity. She specializes in Amazon Connect, Architecting Resilient, and Secure systems in the cloud. As an Amazon Connect Ambassador, she helps businesses enhance their customer experiences. Her unwavering passion for learning has earned her numerous AWS certifications (9X), solidifying her expertise in the field.


Before transitioning into the tech industry, Sabiha was a passionate Mathematics teacher. Inspired by her love for logical problem-solving, she made an impressive 180-degree career change to become a Solutions Architect. Her background as a teacher equips her with strong communication skills and an ability to simplify complex concepts. She firmly believes that anything is possible, that it is never too late to pursue ones dreams, and one can overcome any challenge and embark on a fulfilling career path.


Starting out as an active AWS Community Builder, she became an AWS User Group Leader in Dubai, and has helped create a vibrant and one of the most active communities of AWS users around the globe. Sabiha is also committed to empowering women in the tech industry, making her a valued professional and an advocate for change.

name: SangUk Park
description:
SangUk Park is a Chief Solutions Architect at Megazone, which became Korea's first AWS Partner in 2012 and is the only AWS Premier Consulting Partner to provide AWS support in Korean.


He served as a System Architect for KTs public cloud and VDI design, and led the system operation of YDOnline and Nexon Japan, one of the leading online gaming companies. Certified both as an AWS Solutions Architect - Professional and AWS DevOps Engineer - Professional, SangUk has authored AWS books, including DevOps and AWS Cloud Design Patterns, and translated four books related to the AWS Cloud.


Hes been making efforts to revitalize the local AWS Korea User Group community as co-leader by presenting at AWS Korea User Group meetings and AWS Summits, and helping to establish small group gatherings such as the AWSKRUG System Engineers in Gangnam. Also, he has done many hands-on labs and has been running a booth as a leader of the user groups at AWS events to cultivate developers and system engineers.


SangUk maintains a close relationship with the Japanese AWS User Group (JAWS UG), using his excellent Japanese communication skills and experiences in Japan. He makes every effort to participate in events held between Japanese and Korean user groups as a facilitator and translator, and will promote cross-regional communications beyond APAC going forward.

name: Scott Liao
description: The AWS Heroes program recognizes a vibrant, worldwide group of AWS experts whose enthusiasm for knowledge-sharing has a real impact within the community. Heroes go above and beyond to share knowledge in a variety of ways including online via social media, blog posts, open source projects, videos, and forums; or in person at conferences, workshops, and user group events.

name: Serhat Can
description: Serhat is a passionate technologist, community leader, and co-founder & product development director at JumpCloud. Prior to his current role as Director, Product Management at JumpCloud, he served as the co-founder and CEO at Resmo. Serhat also holds the prestigious title of AWS Community Hero, acknowledging his expertise and contributions to cloud computing. He enjoys delving deeply into every aspect of building outstanding products. Hes currently based in Ankara, Turkey.

name: Shaoyi Li
description:
Shaoyi Li is a Lead Cloud Engineer focusing on cybersecurity and GenAI, advocating for cloud GenAI security and governance solutions to help the community build secure, compliant, and responsible GenAI applications. He partners with the security community to reinforce the mindset that "security is job zero." He has obtained 13x AWS Certifications and 68x AWS Learning Badges, demonstrating his enthusiasm and professional expertise in AWS technologies.


Shaoyi Li is a regular speaker at AWS events, such as AWS Summits, AWS media events, AWS Community Days, and AWS User Group Meetups. He also shares his insights in AWS case studies, AWS blogs, official AWS WeChat channels, community.aws, and social media. His impactful AWS content has attracted over 110,000 followers, 10 million views, and 1.16 million likes on his multiple social media. He also received the 2023 Annual Best Tech Blogger and Best Certification Ambassador award from AWS Training & Certification in the greater China region. As an AWS User Group committee member in the greater China region, Shaoyi Li supports the members by helping them deepen their expertise in AWS technology to deliver more high-quality events to the community. Additionally, as an advocate for the AWS Cloud Club program, he continually helps coach many captain candidates across multiple regions with their applications.


His cloud journey never ends, much like his commitment to the AWS community. His dedication, hard work, and persistence in his AWS cloud journey have inspired many developers in underrepresented regions. Influenced by him, many people have successfully launched their cloud journeys and begun sharing their knowledge with the community.

name: Shigeru Oda
description:
Shigeru Oda is an expert system engineer at NSD CO., LTD. He has used his knowledge of AWS and community management skills gained through community activities to develop, design, and train others to use cloud technology within their companies.


He joined the Japan AWS User Group (JAWS-UG) in January 2020 and has since run 25 events with the JAWS-UG Beginners Chapter (about 4,200 registered members). In September 2020 he promoted the 24-hour online event JAWS SONIC 2020 & MIDNIGHT JAWS 2020 as a steering member, which was attended by about 1,500 people.


In March 2021, he promoted JAWS DAYS 2021 as a steering member, which was attended by about 4,000 people from all over Japan. And in November 2021, he promoted JAWS PANKRATION 2021, a second 24-hour online event, providing 900 AWS users in Japan as well as around the world with an opportunity to learn beyond the language barrier of English and Japanese through simultaneous interpretation.


He received the AWS Samurai 2021 Award for these activities.

name: Shimon Tolts
description: Shimon leads an AWS User Group that was established in 2013 and has more than 8000 members. He also creates tutorial videos about cloud technology and Kubernetes. In addition, Shimon is a maintainer of the Datree open-source project (https://github.com/datreeio/datree 6000+ Stars), a cloud native solution to prevent Kubernetes misconfigurations by blocking resources that do not meet your policy.

name: Simone Merlini
description:
Simone is CEO and CTO at beSharp, an Italian AWS Advanced Consulting Partner focused on cloud architectures and cloud-native software development. He holds a Ph.D. in Computer Science, and he serves as an adjunct professor of Cloud Computing at the University of Pavia. In 2012 he co-founded the first AWS User Group in Italy, and he's currently the organizer of the AWS User Group Milan.


Simone has been using the AWS cloud since 2007. Since then, he has successfully guided and developed many projects focusing on cloud infrastructures, continuous deployment, backup and disaster recovery, serverless, cloud security, and networking. He's also actively involved in the development of Leapp, an open-source project for managing and securing cloud access in multi-account environments.


Simone is an active member of the AWS Community. As an APN Ambassador, he participates in several events and conferences as a speaker. He's also the editor in chief and writer for Proud2beCloud, a blog by beSharp aimed to share highly specialized AWS knowledge to enable adoption of cloud technologies.

name: Stephen Borsay
description:
Stephen Borsay is a Degreed Computer Engineer and electronic hobbyist with a passion to make IoT and embedded systems understandable and enjoyable to enthusiasts of all experience levels. His engineering background includes development of MCUs, FPGAs, and technical training. These days his main focus is AWS IoT and device to cloud integration.


Stephen authors community IoT projects, as well as develops online teaching materials focused on AWS IoT to solve problems for both professional developers and casual IoT enthusiasts. He founded the Digital Design meetup group in Portland, Oregon which holds regular meetings focusing on hands-on IoT training. He regularly posts IoT tutorials for Hackster.io. You can also find his online AWS IoT training courses on YouTube and Udemy.


His new course on Serverless IoT on AWS is scheduled to be released in March 2020. This course will instruct students on how to build AWS serverless workflows around IoT data. His new book "AWS Serverless IoT" is now available on Amazon.

name: Steve Bjorg
description:
Steve Bjorg was the Founder and Chief Technical Officer at MindTouch (acquired by NICE CXone in 2021), a San Diego-based enterprise software company that specializes in customer self-service software. He is a seasoned technologist and serial entrepreneur who is passionate about helping others. Prior to founding MindTouch, Steve worked in Advanced Strategies and the Developer Division at Microsoft, focusing on distributed computing.


Steve is a frequent contributor to open-source projects and is passionate about serverless software. He is the author of LambdaSharp - a tool for optimizing the developer experience when building Serverless .NET applications on AWS. Prior projects include DReAM, a service-oriented distributed architecture for .NET microservices and DekiWki, a popular enterprise wiki that was among the top 5 projects on SourceForge for many years.


Steve and his team host a monthly serverless hacking challenge in San Diego to learn and master new AWS services and features. The event is open to all levels, pairing beginners and experienced members together who share a love of building cloud software. Reach out to Steve on Twitter about serverless architecture, AWS, or .NET.

name: Steve Teo
description:
Steve works at Horangi Cyber Security, an Amazon Partner Network (APN) Technology Partner. At Horangi, he is building a Cloud Security SaaS to help AWS customers understand, assess, and eliminate risks in their infrastructure.


He has been serving the AWS User Group Singapore Community since 2017. The user group was founded in 2014 and now has over 5000 members. Having benefited and built his career through meetups at the start of his career, he makes it his personal mission to pay it forward and build the community so that others might reap the benefits and contribute back to the community. The community in Singapore has since grown to have regularly monthly meetups and now includes an Enterprise User Group sub-chapter. He is also on the advisory board of Cloud Seeders, a cloud-learning community for beginners, with an objective to bring more women and diverse talents to the cloud ecosystem.


He is passionate about his pet topics such as Multi-Account Strategy and Cloud Security and often serves as a speaker in AWS APAC Community Conferences on these subjects, where he shares his slides on his Speakerdeck.


One fun fact about Steve is that he successfully defended Unicorn Rentals in his first ever AWS Gameday with an awesome team back in re:Invent 2018 and won the coveted Unicorn trophy!

name: TaeSeong Park
description: Description not found

name: Takuya Tachibana
description:
Takuya Tachibana is the CEO of Heptagon inc. and Director of DigitalCube Co. Ltd. He is in the business of solving countryside issues using AWS.


Since 2012, Tachibana has been contributing to the Japan AWS User Group (JAWS-UG) for more than 10 years. He has also been a speaker at over 100 community and cloud events throughout all of Japan.


He served as the JAWS-UG representative in 2016-2017 and as Chair of the JAWS DAYS 2017. He has also spoken at overseas events, such as AWS Summit Seoul, AWS Summit Beijing, and AWS Community Day APAC.


Tachibana continues to share the appeal of AWS with the local community and in the countryside areas, focused in AWS businesses utilizing serverless, machine learning, and IoT. In addition, he also advocates for AWS and encourages builders to contribute to the greater AWS community, and believes there are no limits: you can grow no matter where you live, what you do, or how old you are.

name: Tiago Rodrigues
description:
Tiago is a Senior Cloud Consultant at tecRacer.com, an AWS Premier Tier Services Partner and AWS Advanced Tier Training Partner, operating for over a decade with offices across Germany, Switzerland, Austria, and Portugal. With diverse experience ranging from Startups to Enterprise projects, Tiago specializes in migrations from on-premises environments to the cloud, but also in modernizing architectures or implementing serverless solutions from idea to production.


Beyond his professional role, Tiago is deeply committed to knowledge sharing. He actively contributes to the AWS community, e.g. through the AWS User Group Lisbon, educational workshops, and guest lectures at universities to promote a culture of learning and exploring the potential that AWS offers.


Proof of his passion for education and innovation is AWSary, an open source mobile app he developed. AWSary serves as a playful yet informative AWS dictionary that helps draw diagrams for Solution Architects and provides quick insights into AWS services.


Catch Tiago sharing his insights and AWS adventures on his personal blog and at events both locally in Portugal and globally online.

name: Tomasz Lakomy
description:
Tomasz is a Frontend Engineer at Stedi, Co-founder of Cloudash, an egghead.io instructor, and a lifelong learner with a passion for learning in public.


Since 2018, he's been diving into the world of AWS and at the same time sharing what he's learned with others. After passing the AWS Certified Solutions Architect: Associate exam in 2019 he recorded multiple courses on serverless technologies, including Build an App with the AWS Cloud Development Kit, and Learn AWS Lambda from scratch.


In addition, he's active on his Twitter, blog - tlakomy.com, as well as The Practical Dev community, where he posts articles on career advice, testing and - of course - AWS.

name: Vanessa Santos
description:
Vanessa Santos joined the AWS User Group Sao Paulo in 2017. Starting from a non-traditional technical background, she became recognized as an AWS Community Leader in 2019, achieving new learnings and practices through the AWS re:Invent We Power Tech Grant.


Passionate about technology, Vanessa believes people can continuously learn and still be curious for more. She strives to invent and simplify ways to empower people to fulfill a human purpose, using tech skills to support their own communities, enabling ways to think bigger than ever, and creating impact as catalysts.


Vanessa works with local and international AWS User Groups as an AWS UG Sao Paulo co-organizer, with female and black tech communities, as an MBA Lecturer, and as council volunteer for Brazilian health tech. She has also worked at Brazilian AWS Consulting Partners, shifting roles as she expanded her tech skills, gathering certifications and supporting individual and company certification in multiple AWS Competencies. She currently works on the Global Segment Marketing team at Equinix.

name: Vishal Alhat
description:
Vishal Alhat is a senior software engineer at Forcepoint, a leading cybersecurity company, where he leverages his 9+ years of experience to play a key role in cloud-based deployments. He focuses on cloud security and DevOps using AWS, implementing DevOps tools, AWS services, and best practices to automate deployments and ensure consistency across Forcepoint's cloud infrastructure.


Passionate about sharing his knowledge, mentoring people, and fostering the AWS community, Vishal is an active and recognized leader. He was selected as the AWS Community Builder of the Year for the APJ region, a testament to his dedication. Vishal regularly speaks at international conferences, meetups, AWS Community Days, and summits worldwide. He's also the AWS User Group Pune leader, where his leadership extends beyond just organizing meetups. Vishal is known for his ability to effectively organize and speak at large-scale community events that inspire and educate.


Vishal's expertise lies in cloud security and DevOps on AWS. He frequently shares his learnings and insights by publishing articles on his blog and LinkedIn profile.

name: Vit Niennattrakul
description:
Vit Niennattrakul finished his Ph.D. in time series data mining and is also interested in machine learning, artificial intelligence, and natural language processing. He is a passionate technopreneur who founded startup companies: Stamp (an online-to-offline service provider), Triple-E (a data collection service provider), and Inspica (a data analytics solution provider). Those startup solutions are architected on AWS. He currently runs a company called DailiTech, the first Thai AWS consulting partner that helps partners and customers migrate to the cloud and deliver many born-in-the-cloud and hybrid-cloud solutions. Also, Vit is the first Thai-certified AWS Solution Architect - Professional and has also achieved other AWS certificates later on.


Vit started using AWS in 2013, sensing that AWS was the primary building block to drive innovations in Thailand. But they needed some help to unlock the path to success. They needed places to share and exchange knowledge with AWS users in Thailand. So he started building the AWS User Group (Thailand) with the help of his passionate team and AWS staff in December 2014. He and his team regularly organize meetups and collaborate with AWS on marketing events and seminars. Also, he encourages members to share their experiences and knowledge. In 2022 the community reached 10,000 members and continues to expand.

name: Wojciech Dąbrowski
description:
Wojciech has been an AWS User Group Silesia leader since 2019. During this time, he managed to organize multiple online and offline meetings. Besides that, he conducts workshops and presents cloud computing and software engineering topics.


He is fascinated by the pragmatic approach to software development and the iterative approach to building products and applications. Mainly he uses cloud-native solutions and willingly seeks innovation in his projects.


He helps organize other local initiatives by participating as a speaker, trainer, board member, or host.


Wojciech works as a Solutions and Cloud Architect, ensuring his organization uses the best practices regarding AWS Cloud management, developing applications in the cloud environment, designing new solutions, and improving existing ones.


Currently, he holds the role of AWS Capability Lead for Central Europe in Deloitte and is responsible for projects related to the AWS cloud in Central Europe.
